required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trial of Hypofractionated IMRT Boost Versus Conventional IMRT Boost for Localized High Risk Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Trial of Concomitant Hypofractionated IMRT Boost Versus Conventional Fractionated IMRT Boost for Localized High Risk Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
Hypofractionation: 48 Gy in 25 fractions to pelvic lymph nodes while the prostate receives 68 Gy in 25 fractions concomitantly.
Standard Fractionation: pelvic lymph nodes and prostate will initially be treated to 46 Gy in 23 fractions, followed by a subsequent boost to the prostate to a total dose of 78 Gy over 39 fractions.

detailed_description.textblock:
Half the participants will receive using a one phase IMRT plan, the pelvic lymph nodes will be treated to a dose of 48 Gy in 25 fractions, while the prostate will be treated to a dose of 68 Gy in 25 fractions concomitantly (simulataneous integrated boost).
The other half of the participants will receive Standard fractionation using 2 sequential IMRT plans, the pelvic lymph nodes and prostate will initially be treated to 46 Gy in 23 fractions, followed by a subsequent boost to the prostate to a total dose of 78 Gy.

study_design_info.masking_description: This is a randomized Radiation trial

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome for this study is PSA biochemical disease free survival at 5 years.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 month post completion of treatment to end of 5 year follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v3.0, change from 6 months post treatment to end of 5 year follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life outcome: Expanded Prostate Index Composite (EPIC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (start of treatment) to end of 5 year follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring quality of life using the Expanded Prostate Cancer Index Composite (EPIC) questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of 5 year follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival comparing two treatment arms

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to end of 5 year follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Cancer specific survival comparing two treatment arms

arm_group.description: Hypofractionation: Using a one phase IMRT plan, the pelvic lymph nodes will be treated to a dose of 48 Gy in 25 fractions, while the prostate will be treated to a dose of 68 Gy in 25 fractions concomitantly (simulataneous integrated boost) + 18-36 months of Eligard Hormone injection.

Using 2 sequential IMRT plans, the pelvic lymph nodes and prostate will initially be treated to 46 Gy in 23 fractions, followed by a subsequent boost to the prostate to a total dose of 78 Gy + 18-36 months of Eligard Hormone injection.

intervention.other_name: Eligard 22.5 mg (28.2 mg leuprolide acetate per syringe) [3-Month] for 18-36 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent obtained.
- Histologically confirmed diagnosis of adenocarcinoma of the prostate.
- Clinical stage T1-2 N0 M0, Gleason Score ≤ 7, PSA 20 - 100
- T1-2 N0 M0, Gleason Score 8 - 10, PSA ≤ 100
- T3 N0 M0, any Gleason Score, PSA ≤ 100
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with unilateral or bilateral hip replacement.
- Patients with active collagen vascular disease.
- Patients with active inflammatory bowel disease.
- Patients with previous radiotherapy to the pelvis.
- Patients with ataxia telangiectasia.
- Patients with nodal or distant metastases

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to share Individual Participant data. Results from the trial will be available through publications.
